alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Southern Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 5:34PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lackawanna and southwestern Wayne Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 533 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dickson City, or near Scranton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scranton, Dunmore, Carbondale, Archbald, Blakely, Taylor, Dickson City, Olyphant, Clarks Summit and Jessup. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 184 and 199. Interstate 84 between 1 and 17. Interstate 476 near 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Heavy downpours from this storm may also produce a quick quarter to half inch or rain, to cause ponding of water on roads. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
